intro: Tuberaria villosissima, commonly known as the hairy tuberaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which are often covered in fine, white pubescence. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. Native to southern Europe, it thrives in rocky or limestone soils. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as scrublands and coastal areas.
